justification: “The hypothesis was assessed by estimating the intervention's impact on response rate 1 (RR1)” – indicating RR1 is the operational measure of response propensity.
“Nonresponse bias was assessed by estimating so-called ‘representativity indicators (R indicators)’” – showing R-indicators were used to quantify nonresponse bias.
The study states that measurement error was evaluated through “item nonresponse…”, making the item-nonresponse rate the instrument for measuring this construct.

measured_by: Length of responses to open-ended questions
justification: Measurement error was also gauged by “length of responses to openended questions,” treating response length as the metric for the construct.
The paper lists “non-differentiation” among the metrics for assessing measurement error, indicating straight-lining was the chosen measure.
